reviewText: This movie was directed by Jiri Weiss, a Czech filmmaker that was part of Czech's film new wave. It's filmed in an fascinating way and it has a good jazzy score. Murder Czech Style is about a plain middle-aged clerk who marries a beautiful woman, much to the surprise of his co-workers. But there's a catch in it, she only comes down on weekends and their marriage never consummates. He soon learns the reason why, his wife is having an affair with the office manager. The last hour runs out of steam as the character goes through a few murder scenarios.  2.5 rounded to 3.
